0P00000JXT.F.manager_bio:
Marco Cecchi - Portfolio Manager
Joined: 2000 
Years in Investments: Since 2000
Marco Cecchi is a Portfolio Manager with the Fixed Income team at Pioneer Investment Management S.G.R.p.A. Marco relocated to the Milan investment centre from the Dublin office in 2004. Prior to his current role he worked for two and a half years in the Treasury Desk where he managed the FX exposure on International Bond Funds and cash management for various Pioneer Investmentsâ funds. 
Education / Experience
Marco joined Pioneer Investments in 2000 upon completion of a Masters specialising in Asset Management from Bocconi University and University College Dublin. Before beginning the Masters he worked briefly with IMI San Paolo in Milan. Marco is a Finance graduate of Bocconi University Milan.

0P00000YXI.F.manager_bio: Patrick Barbe has been Head of the European Fixed Income investment team at BNP Paribas Asset Management since 2000. As such, he is responsible for defining and piloting the management process and the investment strategy implemented by the management team. He specifies and coordinates the activities of each of the team members. He also actively participates in designing and developing the product range. Besides his management responsibilities, Patrick is a portfolio manager, in charge of defining duration bets, their size and their day-to-day adjustments, for the team. Patrick has acquired considerable expertise from his long professional experience in credit and fixed income management. Prior to joining BNP Paribas Asset Management, he was Head of European Fixed Income at BNP Gestions (a former BNP Paribas subsidiary) from 1997 to 2000. Between 1995 and 1996, he was Assistant Head of French Fixed Income. From 1988 to 1994, he worked as a portfolio manager for dedicated mutual funds with BNP (a former BNP Paribas subsidiary). Patrick graduated in Actuarial Studies from the Institut de Science FinanciÃ¨re et d'Assurances in Lyon, France (1988).

AVEO.AS.summary:
The investment objective is to achieve a return at least equal to 50% iBoxx â¬ Sovereign 1-10 Index (TR) and 50% iBoxx â¬ Non Sovereign Index (TR), the composite benchmark, and at the same time to realise an ESG score for the fund that is as high as possible.
Investment policy
. ACTIAM Duurzaam Euro Obligatiefonds invests in bonds, private loans or other liquid debt securities and assetbacked securities.
 The fund invests at least 90% in assets with a minimum average rating of BBB- and a maximum of 10% in assets with a lower average rating.
 Asset-backed securities must have a minimum average rating of AA-.
 The weighted average rating of all portfolio investments is at least A-.
 The weighted average duration of the portfolio may deviate by a maximum of 2 years from that of the benchmark.
 The fund may also invest in derivatives, exclusively in swaps, interest rate futures and interest rate options.

KEMP0.AS.summary: Kempen Profielfonds 0 invests in a broad-based portfolio of direct investments in fixed income securities and / or units in collective investments in fixed-income securities . Every year for the Fund, the allocation among the various asset classes ( the ' strategic investment ' ) on the basis of long-term risk and return expectations , subject to the investment restrictions of the Fund . The current strategic investment Administrator publishes the quarterly reports that are available via the Website and makes thereby also an indication of the target ( weighted ) average of the maturities of the investments in fixed-income securities ( "duration") . During the year , the manager may , based on eg economic trends and market signals to decide , subject to the investment restrictions , to deviate from the strategic investment . Information on its strategic investment and tactical adjustments to the strategic investment is made in the quarterly report

NMIDB.MI.long_name: New Millennium - Augustum Italian Diversified Bond L
NMIDB.MI.summary: The Sub-Fund seeks to achieve a moderate growth in the value of capital invested in a medium-term time horizon, through a highly concentrated exposure to bond instruments of Italian issuers, without any currency risk.)

NNEOF.AS.manager_bio:
Senior Portfolio Manager Core FI
Joined ING IM in: 1985
Main responsibilities: Hans is Senior Portfolio Manager at the Core FI team, being responsible for global core fixed income investment policy and model portfolio construction. He is also responsible for managing flagship fixed income mutual funds.
Previous work experience: Prior to this, Hans was employed in the investment department of Nationale-Nederlanden (which later merged into ING Investment Management) starting in 1985 as a fixed income fund manager, with a focus on private placements. He began his career in 1977 at Amfas Group (now part of ING Group) as a portfolio manager.
Education: HES Rotterdam.
Relevant experience since: 1977
